intro: Vincetoxicum officinale var. luteolum, commonly known as the yellow elder, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
